discoveredAssets: http://127.0.0.1:5000/list - Bookmark list display page (200 OK)
http://127.0.0.1:5000/add - Bookmark addition form page (200 OK)
http://127.0.0.1:5000/about - About page with navigation (200 OK)
http://127.0.0.1:5000/static - Static file directory (CSS, JavaScript assets)

targets.objective: Test for web vulnerabilities including input validation bypass, command injection, CSRF, XSS via name and URL parameters, and authentication/authorization flaws
targets.rationale: Form submission endpoint accepting user input (name and URL fields). Should test for injection attacks, file upload if possible, URL validation bypass, and business logic flaws in bookmark storage and retrieval

targets.objective: Investigate functionality and test for privilege escalation, IDOR, CSRF vulnerabilities, and unauthorized access to deletion operations
targets.rationale: Deletion endpoint with unclear behavior - returns 302 on GET but 405 on POST/DELETE. Needs investigation into how deletion is triggered and if proper authorization checks exist

targets.objective: Test for information disclosure, stored XSS in bookmark display, IDOR between users (if multi-user), and business logic flaws in bookmark retrieval and filtering
targets.rationale: Dynamic content display endpoint. Should test how bookmarks are retrieved, displayed, and if there are authorization flaws allowing access to other users' bookmarks

targets.objective: Comprehensive web application security testing including configuration review, error handling analysis, and framework-specific vulnerabilities
targets.rationale: Base application testing to identify Flask-specific misconfigurations, debug modes, and general web application security posture

keyFindings: [MEDIUM] Flask development server (Werkzeug 3.1.3) is running on port 5000 - likely development environment
[MEDIUM] No API documentation endpoints found (/swagger.json, /openapi.json, /api-docs) - API not explicitly documented
[MEDIUM] Form submission endpoint (/add) accepts POST requests - should test for input validation and injection attacks
[LOW] Bootstrap 5.3.0-alpha1 frontend framework used - no known critical vulnerabilities in this version
[LOW] Directory listing disabled on static files (/static/ returns 404) - good security practice
[MEDIUM] /delete endpoint exists but behavior is unclear - returns 302 on GET but 405 on POST, suggesting incomplete or hidden implementation
[LOW] Standard Flask pattern with redirects - POST-Redirect-Get pattern appears to be implemented
[MEDIUM] No visible authentication mechanisms - application may allow unauthenticated bookmark operations (potential IDOR risk)
